boardrelated

Class Square

  • java.lang.Object
    • boardrelated.Square
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    birthdayGiftSquare, bonusSquare, buyableSquare, drawCardSquare, go2jailSquare, goSquare, hollandTunnelSquare, incomeTaxSquare, luxuryTaxSquare, paydaySquare, reverseDirectionSquare, rollOneSquare, squezzePlaySquare, StockExchangeSquare, taxRefundSquare

    public class Square
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the most methods that are used for the Data Type. It is at the very top of the hierarchy of many other classes. It has no specific attribute but a general one. The different squares have their own behaviours in the subclasses. Square just provides the common methods for them such as addPlayerToSquare(), removePlayerFromSquare() etc.
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Cem Uyuk

    • Constructor Detail

      • Square

        public Square(java.lang.String name,
              int squareNumber,
              int trackNumber,
              int colorID,
              int totalPlayers)
        Creates an instance of the Square class. Sets the previous and the next squares that are connected to it null as default.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the square
        squareNumber - the number of the square which is sort of tag
        trackNumber - number of the track that this' instance is on
        colorID - of this square's instance
        totalPlayers - the number of total players on its instance
        Modifies:
        sets the next and previous squares to null by default

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        A call on it returns the color of the square instance.
        Returns:
        the color of the square that this method is called upon

      • arrival_proc

        public void arrival_proc(Player p,
                         Game g)
        The broad instance of square has no arrival procedure. Hence, this procedure when a player arrives does nothing but shouting out that the arrival proc is supposedly happening.
        Parameters:
        p - the player who lands on square instance
        g - the game that the square and player is in

      • passing_proc

        public void passing_proc(Player p,
                         Game g)
        The broad instance of square has no passing procedure. Hence, this procedure when a player passes does nothing but shouting out that the passing proc is supposedly happening.
        Parameters:
        p - the player who lands on square instance
        g - the game that the square and player is in

      • next_square

        public Square next_square(Dice d,
                          Player p)
        Returns the square after the insatance of Square
        Parameters:
        d - the dice of the game
        p - any player that can show the reverse direction movement
        Returns:
        a square after the instance that this procedure is called upon
